text.0: i will declare the mighty deeds of viṣṇu of him who measured out the earthly regions.
text.1: who propped the highest place of congregation thrice setting down his footstep widely striding.
text.2: for this his mighty deed is viṣṇu lauded like some wild beast dread prowling mountainroaming.
text.3: he within whose three wideextended paces all living creatures have their habitation.
text.4: let the hymn lift itself as strength to viṣṇu the bull farstriding dwelling on the mountains.
text.5: him who alone with triple step hath measured this common dwellingplace long far extended.
text.6: him whose three places that are filled with sweetness imperishable joy as it may list them.
text.7: who verily alone upholds the threefold the earth the heaven and all living creatures.
text.8: may i attain to that his wellloved mansion where men devoted to the gods are happy.
text.9: for there springs close akin to the widestrider the well of meath in viṣṇus highest footstep.
text.10: fain would we go unto your dwellingplaces where there are manyhorned and nimble oxen.
text.11: for mightily there shineth down upon us the widelystriding bulls sublimest mansion.
